alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:07PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln and eastern Marathon Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 706 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Merrill, or 13 miles north of Wausau, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wausau around 725 PM CDT. Rib Mountain around 730 PM CDT. Weston around 740 PM CDT Mosinee around 800 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Glandon, Ringle, Pike Lake, Little Chicago, Schofield, Hamburg, Nutterville, Hatley, Sunset and Peplin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
